125.title: "How You and Your Lover can Make Millions and be Popular while Running the Marathon Diet Cookbook"
125.author: by Jerry Dumas and Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Sam and Silo are looking at titles in a bookstore window.

126.heading: Cookbooks.
126.title: "How's It Work?"
126.author: by Glenn McCoy.
notes: Summary: Gina has given Eno a cookbook, and he's not sure what to do with it.

127.heading: Cookbooks.
127.title: "I Did Better than That!"
127.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Helga asked for a French cookbook from Paris, but Hagar brought a chef.

128.heading: Cookbooks.
128.title: "I Don't Want to Impose"
128.author: Wilson & DiPreta.
notes: Summary: Dexter has a new microwave, and Wendy offers to bring some cookbooks over.

129.heading: Cookbooks.
129.title: "I Got Cookie a French Cookbook"
129.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Zero thinks Sarge's idea is funny, because Cookie can't read French.

130.heading: Cookbooks.
130.title: "I Just Got to the Part about Chopping Onions"
130.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood is reading in bed and crying. Blondie asks if he's reading a love story, but it's a cookbook.

131.heading: Cookbooks.
131.title: "I Lent Her My Best Cookbook and She Didn't Return It!"
131.author: LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Sam goes to Holly Farm, finds nobody there, and talks to a neighbor.

132.heading: Cookbooks.
132.title: "I'd Better Get Out of This Cookbook Section"
132.author: by W
notes: Summary: A goose in a library is alarmed at being watched by a dog.

133.heading: Cookbooks.
133.title: "Imagine Getting That Excited Over a Mexican Cookbook"
133.author: Young & Gersher.
notes: Summary: Dagwood is enthusiastically reading in bed.

134.heading: Cookbooks.
134.title: "Isn't There a Seven-Day Waiting Period?"
134.author: by Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Leroy is amazed that Loretta was able to buy a cookbook so easily.

135.heading: Cookbooks.
135.title: "It's a Cookbook with Pictures"
135.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Honi is amazed to see her illiterate father engrossed in a book.

136.heading: Cookbooks.
136.title: "It's For Bachelors Trying to Impress a Girl on Their First Date"
136.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi has cooked something from a book called Cooking For Men, and the kids like it.

137.heading: Cookbooks.
137.title: "Just as I Thought, it's a Cookbook"
137.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood finds the book he's reading in bed to be inspiring and suggestive, and Blondie takes a look at it.

138.heading: Cookbooks.
138.title: "Just Like the Picture in the Cook Book!"
138.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Betty and Wilma like the way the dish looks, and so does the dinosaur who has lifted the roof to see it.

139.heading: Cookbooks.
139.title: "Looked Better Than It Tasted"
139.author: by Jim Davis.
notes: Summary: Garfield and Jon are looking at a cookbook, and Garfield rips out a page and eats it.

140.heading: Cookbooks.
140.title: "Loretta's Writing a Cookbook. The Dedication is to Chef Boyardee"
140.author: by Hoest & Reiner.

141.heading: Cookbooks.
141.title: "A Map of all the Fast Food Places"
141.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: She's selling what she calls "The Bachelor's Cookbook."

142.heading: Cookbooks.
142.title: "My Cookbook Flunked the Compatibility Quiz"
142.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy cancels dinner, because every recipe calls for something she doesn't have.

143.heading: Cookbooks.
143.title: "I'm Selling Irish Cookbooks"
143.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: A salesman uses flattery.

144.heading: Cookbooks.
144.title: "Our Health Insurance Company Stopped By And Took All Your Cookbooks"
144.author: Hoest & Reiner.

145.heading: Cookbooks.
145.title: "A Plugger Heirloom"
145.author: Brookins.
notes: Summary: The heirloom is grandmother's cookbook.

146.heading: Cookbooks.
146.title: "Poke Holes in Plastic Cover"
146.author: by Bob Thaves.
notes: Summary: In the cookbook section of a bookstore or library, Ernest reveals his knowledge of cookery.

147.heading: Cookbooks.
147.title: "The Ravenous Rambler's Guide to Haute Cuisine?"
147.author: Hall.
notes: Summary: She wonders at his approach to back-to-basics backpacking, especially the cookbook.

148.heading: Cookbooks.
148.title: "Read a Cookbook!"
148.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus is impatient for his supper.

149.heading: Cookbooks.
149.title: "Scratch-and-Sniff Cookbook"
149.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Roz has a new book out, a cookbook without pictures.

150.heading: Cookbooks.
150.title: "Sy Wharton's New Novel is a Cookbook?"
150.author: by Paul Nichols, LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Abbey and Gloria get Sam to show them the manuscript.

151.heading: Cookbooks.
151.title: "There is No Gift as Friendly as a Book!"
151.author: Hanan.
notes: Summary: Louie leaves the house with a vase bouncing off his head, and returns to a smoke-filled kitchen with a gift from the bookstore. He leaves the house again with a cookbook bouncing off his head.

152.heading: Cookbooks.
152.title: "There's One Girl Who Isn't Going to Stay Lonesome When the War's Over"
152.author: by Clark.
notes: Summary: A librarian remarks on the patron who only checks out cookbooks.

153.heading: Cookbooks.
153.title: "Tropical Fish are Very Delicate"
153.author: Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Grimm studies up on the care of goldfish using a cookbook to determine the temperature and chemicals needed (i.e., a tablespoon of salt).

154.heading: Cookbooks.
154.title: "Wait Until I Get My Cookbook!"
154.author: Gordon Bess.
notes: Summary: Redeye wants Mawsquaw to boil some water so he can show her how a tea bag works.

155.heading: Cookbooks.
155.title: "What on Earth is a Terrorist Cookbook, Sylvia?"
155.author: Saunders and Giella.
notes: Summary: Brad has moved on from picket signs and bullhorns to bombs.

156.heading: Cookbooks.
156.title: "What's It Called, Suffer with the Stars?"
156.author: by Lynn Johnston.
156.series: For Better or For Worse, May 23, 1985
notes: Summary: Ellie is trying out a celebrity diet cookbook.

157.heading: Cookbooks.
157.title: "Where Diet Books?"
157.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The Tasmanian Devil eats the cookbooks at Bugs' bookstore, weighs himself, and returns to the bookstore.

158.heading: Cookbooks.
158.title: "Why Not? It Might Trigger a Rash of Antidote Books"
158.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: The Fat Broad proposes a cookbook to Peter's Publishing Co.

159.heading: Cookbooks.
159.title: "You'd Better Have a Drink Before Dinner"
159.author: Hoest & Reiner.
notes: Summary: Loretta warns Leroy about a typographical error in the cookbook.

160.heading: Cookbooks.
160.title: "Your Instant Chef's Delight"
160.author: by Adal Maldonado and June Ponte
160.appears_in: p. 86-87 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 9 (Dec. 1982).
notes: Pork chops made from a cook book.
Fotonovela style.
